attributes.action: Make MP’s voting for Internal market bill responsible for any resulting fines
attributes.additional_details: Given that the government have already admitted that this act breaks the law, It is blatantly obvious that it is criminally negligent to proceed to go ahead and do it. I believe the ONLY reason MP's will proceed and take this course of action anyway is because they know that some other mug (the UK taxpayer) will fund their bill.
attributes.background: I believe individuals should be responsible for their actions. If individual MP's want to pass this legislation they should expect to live with the consequences not the UK taxpayers. So I want individual MP's responsible to be held legally responsible for any resulting fines issued by the ECJ

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Penalties and liabilities are a matter for the courts, and not the UK Government or Parliament itself.
